column1: Edward ""Fullmetal Alchemist"" Elric is a young alchemical prodigy. He is the youngest State Alchemist ever to be recognized by the Amestris State Military
column2: having received the title at the age of 12. Ed's primary motivation throughout the series is to return his younger brother
column3: Alphonse
column4: to his original body
column5: which was lost in a failed human transmutation. Edward
column6: despite his occasional bouts of immaturity
column7: is a selfless boy who gains a reputation as a ""hero of the people"" throughout his youth. Notably
column8: he doesn't seem concerned about returning his own arm and leg
column9: instead focusing entirely on Al's suffering.

column1: Edward is small for his age
column2: standing at only 149 cm (4'11"")
column3: however his body is that of an experienced martial artist
column4: with noticeable muscles and a wealth of agility. Although he lacks both his right arm and left leg
column5: Ed's ability to fight is not impaired
column6: and is in fact improved
column7: as he will often use alchemy to cause his metal arm to partly transform into a blade or shield. His heavy automail limbs are considered by him to be the very best in Amestris. They were made by his childhood friend
column8: Winry Rockbell
column9: and she is constantly working on them. He is able to think quickly
column10: even in desperate situations
column11: though can still be frightened into paralysis. These qualities
column12: combined with his alchemical powers and physical strength
column13: make him a formidable fighter.

column1: Born to Trisha Elric and Van Hohenheim of Resembool in the winter of 1899
column2: Edward's first few years were relatively happy; but after the sudden departure of his father during the lad's formative years
column3: Ed was left with his mother and younger brother Alphonse as his only family. The three Elrics lived in peace in the rural village and the boys began displaying a remarkable talent for alchemy at a young age
column4: much to the joyful astonishment of his mother. However
column5: early in the year 1904
column6: Trisha contracted an illness that had been spreading in the area and died
column7: leaving her two sons orphaned. Even while mourning
column8: mired in grief
column9: Edward vowed to his brother that the two of them would find a way to bring their dear mother back to life with the power of alchemy.

column1: Edward and Alphonse spent the next few years living on their own in the Elric family home
column2: supported by their close childhood friend Winry Rockbell and her grandmother Pinako
column3: and pursuing the alchemical knowledge necessary for their planned resurrection. Although they had gained a great deal of information and comprehension regarding the extended basics of the craft
column4: before long it became apparent to the young prodigies that there was only so far they could go while being self-taught. In a stroke of good fortune
column5: Resembool was visited by an exceptionally skilled alchemist named Izumi Curtis who
column6: after some persuasion
column7: agreed to take the Elric brothers on as her apprentices provided they pass a preliminary test. After they do
column8: the Elric brothers were subjected to Izumi's intensive alchemy and martial arts training
column9: growing significantly in both mind and body and gaining a great deal of alchemical knowledge before returning to Resembool.

column1: Though instructed specifically by Izumi to understand that death is an irreversible part of the flow of the world and that acceptance of such is important to the ""One is All
column2: All is One"" concept
column3: the boys dove headlong into their plan to resurrect their mother upon their homecoming
column4: having advanced their knowledge while abroad and discovered the basics to a forbidden practice called Human Transmutation.

column2: amassing the elemental ingredients for an adult human body and offering their own blood as soul and biological data
column3: the boys secretly initiated the Human Transmutation in their home. Unfortunately
column4: the Human Transmutation resulted in a Rebound.

column1: Alphonse and Edward were pulled into The Gate. Encountering the mysterious being called Truth
column2: Edward was stripped of his left leg in exchange for crossing into God's domain and peeking at the Gate's vast wealth of alchemical knowledge. Maimed and bleeding
column3: Edward was returned to the human dimension to find that Alphonse had not yet returned from his disappearance into the Gate
column4: that the mother they had attempted to revive was a grotesque mass of organs only capable of sustaining life for a few moments and that his own sojourn into the Gate had granted him the curious ability to perform transmutations merely by clapping his hands together
column5: without the aid of a Transmutation Circle - in the same style used by Izumi. Desperate to at least have his brother by his side
column6: Edward willfully performed another Human Transmutation to call him back
column7: this time sacrificing his right arm in exchange for Al's soul
column8: which he bound alchemically to an antique suit of armor with a Blood Rune before passing out from severe blood loss. Alphonse carried Ed to the Rockbell house
column9: where a shocked Pinako and Winry performed emergency surgery to save the young boy's life.

column1: On the night of the failed transmutation. Lt. Colonel Flame alchemist Roy Mustang came to the Rockbell's in response to a letter that Edward and Alphonse had sent him in the mail asking about their Father. He was shocked at the fact that the two boys had tried human alchemy and survived
column2: and informed them that they could become state alchemist and maybe one day find a way to return their bodies to the way they were. Desperate to get His younger brother's body back
column3: Edward asked the Rockbells to give him prosthetic limbs called automail. Though they warned him the surgery would be painful
column4: he said the pain was nothing compared to what his brother had given up. He only took a year to adapt to the automail at age 11 when it took most adults 3 years."

column1: Alphonse Elric is a fictional character in the manga and anime series Fullmetal Alchemist. He is a human child who lost his body during a forbidden alchemical transmutation to bring his deceased mother back to life
column2: and had his soul transmuted into a suit of armor by his brother
column3: Edward Elric. Al's blood seal lies just below the base of the neck at the back of the suit
column4: on the inside. It is drawn with Ed's blood. According to Edward
column5: he needs to be careful whenever he reconstructs Alphonse's body because he must keep the blood seal intact during the transmutation. If the blood seal is removed
column6: Al's soul will be lost.

column1: Kindness in a can."" - Edward Elric

having absolute control over heat and fire through alchemy. Using special gloves that create a spark when he snaps his fingers
column3: Roy can create anything from a tiny ember to burn a letter
column4: to a raging inferno that can destroy a humanoid body in seconds. His precise control over the alchemically enhanced flame is so accurate that he can boil the water in a persons' eyes and can also attack enemies amongst a riot without hurting any allies.

column2: Mustang is intelligent and almost always one step ahead of his opponents
column3: and likes to feel in control of the situation. He is one of the superiors of Edward Elric. On the surface

Mustang's true goal is to become Führer in order to gain the power to reform the government in order to absolve his sins in the Ishval War as well as change the country for the better

he is forced to open the gate by Pride and Wrath

column1: Maes Hughes is a character that is hard not to love. He is often seen as the comedy relief but has his debuts as a serious and skilled fighter. Maes would do anything for his wife Gracia and always carries pictures of his daughter Elycia in his uniform and never misses a chance to show everyone how cute she is. He starts out in the anime as a Major in the Investigation Division and eventually becomes a Lieutenant Colonel.
He is killed by Envy upon his discovery of Father's plans

nicknamed the ""Ultimate Shield"". He is able to rearrange the carbon in his body to make his skin as hard as diamond

column4: and sometimes shows a more fragile side of herself. She relies on Lawrence for company as she fears loneliness

column2: Ittou;Ittou Ogami (拝 一刀);"Ittou ""Lone Wolf"" Ogami";"

column1: Ogami Itto seemed to have a very cushy life during Edo-Era Japan
column2: for he had been the Shogun's official executioner (Kogi Kaishakunin). A position so powerful
column3: the term ""Second"" meant that Itto was only second to the Shogun as far as metering out death to unloyal feudal lords throughout the 60 regions of Shogunate controlled Japan. In fact
column4: the Shogun's symbol of the Hollyhock crest was a noticeable part of Ogami's court attire
column5: thus deeming his stature as indeed being the Shogun's final say over his people. The Kogi Kaishakunin was highest of the three positions given to certain clans of samurai under the Shogun to root out corruption amongst the feudal lords who answered to his Highness about the land. The second clan was the Yagyu who assassinated anyone caught doing treasonous deeds. The third clan was the Kurokawa. Shinobi (ninja) sent to spy on daimyos (lords) and report back to the Shogunate.

column2: by protecting his Highness during the contest to choose the Executioner. The opponent
column3: Gunbei Yagyu
column4: disarmed Itto but blatantly pointed the tip of his sword at the Shogun in his victory over Itto. Ogami seeing this as a direct threat to his Highness stepped in between the sword and the Shogun and thus won the slot of Kogi Kaishakunin. This did not bode well with the ancient patriarch of the Yagyu
column5: Lord Retsudo. Angered that his son lost on a technicality
column6: he plotted against Itto and eventually set off the events that would transform the Shogun's executioner into the assassin known as Kozure Okami (Lone Wolf and Cub).

column1: Returning home from work one evening
column2: Itto finds his pregant wife Azami more fragile than she should be. It seems Lady Ogami has been suffering from terrible nightmares as of late
column3: that the men Itto put to death were cursing the Ogami line. Ogami comforts his wife by explaining if the child they were expecting was a boy
column4: why he chose the name Daigoro. Sadly
column5: Azami's premonition comes true as she is murdered the next day. To further destroy Itto politically and literally
column6: a death tablet bearing the emblem of the Hollyhock crest is placed in the shine he built to pray for the people he was required to execute.

column1: And this is where things fall apart
column2: finding his wife dead (and Daigoro cut out of his mother's womb)
column3: Itto is devastated. The next morning
column4: the chief inspector of the region (a Yagyu named Bizen)
column5: reveals to Itto that he is being tried for treason again his Highness
column6: because of the blasphemous memorial tablet rumored to be in the Ogami memorial shrine. Itto-completely perplexed by such an accusation-agrees to let Bizen investigate the rumor
column7: only to find that there is such a tablet in the shrine!

column1: While Bizen expects Itto to accept his fate of seppuku and slay both himself and his newborn son
column2: Ogami soon smells a rat and realizes that the Ura Yagyu (the shadow Yagyu clan led by Retsudo) are behind this plot to undo him. After he refuses to kill himself and his son
column3: Itto proceeds to cut through the Yagyu guards sent to ensure that Ogami follows the order through. Instead
column4: a deal is made between Retsudo and Itto; a quick battle to decide if Itto will live outside of the region of Edo
column5: or die right then and there
column6: Ogami swears vengeance on the Yagyu clan and thus takes his son into Meifumado (Hell). Becoming an assassin and leaving his official samurai life behind
column7: Itto can strike back at his most hated foes and eventually bring down the clan who murdered his wife and ruined his House.

column1: For 500 gold pieces and the condition that every aspect of why the employer wants the assassination done
column2: Itto now known as Kozure Okami
column3: sets about bringing his own brand of justice to the realm
column4: all the while teaching Daigoro what it means to be samurai. And what a journey it is. Pushing his son around Japan in a souped up wooden
column5: metal and bamboo baby cart
column6: it's a strange and loving testament between father and son.

column3: and is a master of ""suemono giri"" (cutting through stationery objects). Another note: his name might not really be a name but the title ""sacred sword"" which almost sounds like a translation of his name.

column1: Rouka is characterized by the concept of ""schadenfreude""; in which she derives pleasure from the misfortune of others. A self-proclaimed collector misfortunes

column2: her desire for collecting misfortunes is one of malice. Though she genuinely sympathizes towards her customers' issues
column3: her actions are maliciously self-beneficial and acted out with impartiality towards her customers. She justifies her sense of ""evil"" as non-harmful

Rouka had been collecting the various body parts of the ""Rainy Devil"" apparition since she viewed its problem-solving abilities as a competitor and threat to her business. column2: Kousei;Kousei Arima (有馬 公生);"Kousei ""Friend A

column1: Kousei is a prodigy pianist and was the youngest pianist to win the Saki Competition but quit playing after the death of his mother resulted in his inability to hear the sounds of his own playing. Following the death of his mother
column2: he lived two years without playing the piano and saw the world through monotone colors
column3: but this changed after meeting Kaori Miyazono
column4: a beautiful young musician who pushed Kousei to his limits in an attempt to get his fingers back onto the piano keys.

column2: Kousei was obedient and calm. Due to his fear of his mother
column3: Tsubaki was the only one to convince him to tag along in her adventures. Despite being afraid of her
column4: Kousei loved his mother and played freely for her during a competition which angered her. Until later in the story
column5: there are still traces of his mother's verbal and physical abuse that linger in his psyche. Whenever he thought about his piano days
column6: a darkened image of his sick mother would often appear similar to that of a post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) attack. His last performance following the death of his mother traumatized him to the extent of leaving him unable to hear himself play. Despite being unable to play piano
column7: music was omnipresent in his life as he would spend his lunch breaks composing. Despite having friends like Watari and Tsubaki
column8: Kousei spends most of his day alone in his thoughts. This dense characteristic makes him a little oblivious to what is going on around him. For instance
column9: he does not notice the resentment his fellow piano competitors had for him nor Tsubaki's crush on him. He also stares at Kaori for long
column10: awkward periods thinking how great of a person she is which she misinterprets as him having perverted thoughts of her. Kousei admires Kaori because she is his opposite; he wishes to become more free-spirited like her. The closer Kousei and Kaori get
column11: the more his feelings for her deepen and the more he opens up to other people. She helps him build his confidence and convinces him to perform again.

column1: Kousei became a piano player at the request of his mother's friend

column2: currently serving in the 2nd fleet of the Free Planets Alliance.

column1: The son of a merchant and a pacifist at heart

column6: Yang accepted her decision and they remained friends.

column2: Yang became involved in a battle near the friendly planet El Facil
column3: because of his superiors' incompetence and cowardice
column4: the planet was abandoned while a hostile imperial fleet was on its way. Yang was one of the few officers that remained behind and tried to help the population
column5: thanks to his efforts the planet was evacuated in time. Because of this achievement he became famous as ""the hero of El Facil"" and ""miracle Yang
column6: forever earning the envy of his peers and the scorn of his superiors.

column1: It was at El Facil that Yang first became interested in tactics

column3: his novel tactical suggestions were being arbitrarily rejected by hostile superiors. Though disappointed and increasingly cynical with the state of affairs in the Alliance

column2: also called ""the magician
column3: is a genius tactician
column4: as well as a competent strategist. Unlike his often proud adversaries

column1: Count Reinhard von Lohengramm is a young admiral in the Galactic Empire.

He was born Reinhard von Müsel to an impoverished aristocratic family. His mother died when he was very young and he only has faint memories of her. His father's will was shattered at about the same time and the only person left to care for young Reinhard was his beloved older sister Annerose. When Reinhard was about ten years old
column2: his family had to move into a middle class suburban neighborhood. There he met Siegfried Kircheis who would become his best and perhaps only friend
column3: but whatever happiness Reinhard managed to find as a child was to be short-lived.

column2: Annerose reluctantly accepted and her father even managed to get some money out of it. Infuriated Reinhard swore vengeance against the emperor
column3: vengeance against the Goldenbaum dynasty and vengeance against the oppressive nobility. He swore that he would never rest until he freed his sister of her predicament and became powerful enough never to be ordered by anyone again.

column1: To achieve his goals and with Kircheis by his side

column3: ever reluctant to accept a fallen aristocrat like him into their ranks
column4: he became an imperial high admiral and was elevated to peerage as the ""count of Lohengramm"". As he steps into the admiralty

column6: which serves as Reinhards flagship from then on.

column1: Nicknamed ""Blonde Brat"" by his enemies and ""Golden Lion"" by his friends

column5: much to the admiration
column6: as well as the horror
column7: of his subordinates. Ambitious and determined
column8: Reinhard is only hindered by his immeasurable pride

column1: Reuenthal appears calm and composed on the outside

column3: second only to Reinhard
column4: and an accomplished tactician
column5: but Reuenthal is
column6: in reality

column1: Hildegard von Mariendorf is one of the principal characters in the series. She served as the New Galactic Fleet's Chief Advisor

column2: usually referred to by the nickname Hilda

column13: and she agreed

column4: snotty young girl; however
column5: exposure to Akari's mood begins to lighten her up as the series progresses. This does not stop her from telling the other girls to be quiet when they argue
column6: however.

column1: She is just a trainee when Akari and Aika are apprentices
column2: but is already showing a talent for rowing that might surpass both of them (in fact
column3: this is the reason why she was scouted by Orange Planet despite her age). Despite this (and the fact that Akari and Aika are from rival businesses)
column4: she often joins the two in joint practice sessions
column5: and she sincerely enjoys their company.

column1: Alice speaks in a very deadpan manner
column2: and tends to use the word dekkai (でっかい - meaning ""huge"") often in the course of speaking. Aika also commonly addresses her as ""Kohai-chan"" (後輩ちゃん - or ""junior"" said in a friendly manner).
Alice is actually the first to become a prima
column3: efficiently sidestepping the single/journeyman status and earning herself the nickname ""Orange Princess"" (as seen above.) Alice not becoming a single might be because she was going to school
column4: and because Orange Planet didn't want to burden her with the addition of potentially being able to take on customers when accompanied by a Prima
column5: as she arguably had the talent to become a single even before she met Akari and Aika. (Since the single test is basically rowing up the canal to the Hill of Hope.

column2: Alicia;Alicia Florence (アリシア・フローレンス);"Alicia ""Snow White"" Florence";"

column1: The only other undine with Aria Company
column2: Alicia is one of the Three Water Fairies of Neo-Venezia
column3: known by the title ""Snow White"".

column1: At the start of the series
column2: she is 19 years old and the most popular undine in the city
column3: noted especially for her graceful rowing style. She was promoted to Prima at 15
column4: the youngest ever to do so. Like Akari
column5: she is relaxed and easy-going
column6: but she also likes to tease others
column7: especially her childhood friend Akira.

column1: Her favorite phrase is ara ara and she frequently giggles
column2: to Akira's annoyance. According to Grandma Akino
column3: she is an excellent undine because of her ability to enjoy everything.

column1: At the end of the series
column2: Alicia announces her upcoming marriage (though to whom is never stated) and retirement to take an administrative position with the Gondola Association. She tells Akari she had put off her Prima exam because she had been planning to retire after that
column3: and did not want to leave her student and friend. According to issue #6 of Monthly Undine
column4: after her retirement
column5: ""Snow White"" is designated the 8th ""honored appellation"" by the Gondola Association
column6: as an undine who made great contributions to the industry."

column2: Aika S.;Aika S. Granzchesta (藍華・S・グランチェスタ);"Aika S. ""Gatchapen
column3: Rozen Queen"" Granzchesta";"

column2: February 2

column1: The first friend Akari ever made on Aqua
column2: Aika is an undine for Himeya
column3: the oldest and currently second-ranking water-guide company in Neo-Venezia. As the only daughter of its owners
column4: she is also Himeya's heir
column5: but does not enjoy the distinction that much
column6: as she feels that she is fawned upon too much by the company's employees.

column1: Aika often speaks in an open and blunt manner
column2: and goes out of her way to cut off Akari's many idealistic comments with a preemptive ""Embarrassing remarks are not allowed!"" (恥ずかしいセリフ禁止！
column3: Hazukashii serifu kinshi!). Despite their contrasting personalities
column4: she gets along quite well with Akari
column5: and later with Alice. She is very proud of her undine abilities
column6: and tends to be very competitive in this aspect. She also worships Alicia
column7: and finds any excuse to go over to Aria company and spend time with her. Aika once said that if it was not for the obligation to her family
column8: she would join Aria company. Aika has feelings for Al.

column2: Aria;Aria Pokoteng (アリア);"Aria ""President"" Pokoteng";"
it's a tradition to keep a blue-eyed cat (breed is not a problem here) as mascot for good luck.

column1: President Aria is the Aria Company's mascot
column2: a male Aqua breed feline (common trait are bigger than Earth breed and human-level intelligence). He is smart enough to understand human speech. President Aria was a stray cat before being taken in by Grandma twenty years ago and has been the company's mascot ever since.
coupled with Alicia and Akari doting on him
column3: making him really chubby.

column1: He has a crush on President Hime and is mortally afraid of President Maa and her tendency to latch her jaw on to his sizable stomach.

column2: Athena;Athena Glory (アテナ・グローリィ);"Athena ""Siren"" Glory";"
December 24
who works for Orange Planet and acts as Alice's mentor. She tends to be a total airhead who does not really pay attention to anything (in the anime
column3: she once rowed under a bridge and forgot to duck)
column4: but genuinely cares about Alice. She was a trainee undine with Alicia and Akira
column5: and often joined them in joint practice sessions much like Akari
column6: Aika
column7: and Alice do now. Athena has a beautiful singing voice
column8: which she uses to entertain her customers and also to help Alice when she is in some kind of trouble. Athena has a strange laugh
column9: it usually comes out sounding as though she is angry. She came to know Alicia and Akira when they were still trainee undine and practised together back then. She tends to be quiet most of the time but happy to join in having fun. Her appellation as a prima undine is ""Seiren"" (denoted as ""Heavenly Voice"").

column2: Akira E.;Akira E. Ferrari (晃・E・フェラーリ);"Akira E. ""Crimson Rose"" Ferrari";"
July 29

column1: Akira is one of Neo Venezia's three Water Fairies
column2: and is Aika's supervisor with the Himeya company. She is nicknamed the Demon Instructor for her strict training regimen as well as her loud and brusque personality. She is particularly harsh with Aika
column3: in spite of the fact that the girl is her employers' heir
column4: though she does so since she honestly thinks that there is potential in her. As such
column5: she is the only Himeya employee who does not fawn on Aika
column6: though even the latter admits that it is only due to Akira's strictness (and honesty) that she has been able to become a good undine. As a prima undine
column7: she is known as ""Crimson Rose"" (真紅の薔薇).

column1: Akira is famous for her conversational skills as well as her intimate knowledge of the sights to be seen in Neo Venezia. She has a lot of admirers among her customers
column2: though surprisingly enough these are more female than male (which seems to bother her a little
column3: as she considers herself very feminine).

column1: Akira and Alicia's relationship mirrors Akari and Aika's
column2: though Alicia is far more teasing when Akira is around. This isn't that much of a surprise
column3: as Akira and Alicia are childhood friends. However
column4: Akira is still galled that Alicia became a Prima earlier than her
column5: despite the fact that Alicia initially became an undine to tag along with her.

column2: Ai;Ai Aino (愛野アイ);Ai  Aino;"
Ai came to Aqua to explore in a rather negative attitude because her elder sister often boasted to her how good Aqua is
column3: only to find that it was boring. However
column4: meeting & befriending Akari & friends changed Ai's mindset. Ai became the recipient of Akari's letters
column5: and through Akari's mails
column6: Ai started to love Aqua more than ever. Whenever time permits
column7: Ai would pay a visit to Akari in Aqua.

column1: She eventually joins Aria Company a couple of years after Akari becomes a prima
column2: thereby becoming Akari's student."

column1: Cat Sith;Cat Sith  (猫妖精);"Cat Sith ""King of the Cats"" ";"
A very large cat who has powers in black magic. He has been the head of the cat kingdom in Aqua for at least 100 years and is implied as the spiritual guardian of Aqua.

Maa is one of the four major cats in the Aria storyline was adopted as a stray by Alice in the first season. She named her ""Maa-kun"" because all the cat said was ""Maa."" Because of Maa's incredibly small blue pupils
column2: she was made Orange Planet's new president
column3: thus everyone now refers to her as President Maa (Maa-shachou).

column1: Maa is the smallest of the company cats. She is mostly white with patches of black and brown fur. She has a great affinity for biting President Aria's belly and does so whenever she can much to President Aria's dismay."
